metadata.titel_preek: The Sign at Cana: Manifesting the Glory

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus manifests his divine glory through a sign to elicit faith and foreshadow the eschatological banquet and the cross.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus did at Cana in Galilee, and manifested his glory
he himself performs a public action
Jesus’ power of command and his intense sense of purpose

object.identificatie: The manifestation of Glory (Doxa) and the elicitation of Faith
tekstueel_bewijs: manifested his glory; and his disciples believed in him
to declare Jesus’ doxa so as to elicit faith

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Triune God
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus and the Father are one

ontvanger.identificatie: The Disciples / The Church / The Reader
tekstueel_bewijs: appeal not only to John’s contemporary readers, but also to listeners throughout the ages
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one called to behold and believe).

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied via Trinity) and the 'Sign' (Water/Wine)
tekstueel_bewijs: descent of the dove testifies to the Three in One
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject (Jesus) and the Sender (Father).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help manifested through the Trinitarian unity of action.

tekstueel_bewijs: release from the curse that has been cast over all peoples
he will swallow up death forever
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely a lack of wine, but the ontological powers of Sin and Death that require a divine 'hour' to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church's calling to witness to this glory.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / Preacher
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The Church's witness is a response to the primary action of Christ's manifestation.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Manifested Glory → The Disciples/Hearers

voorbeelden_god_subject: He will swallow up death forever
God’s inexhaustible bounty will be poured out
voorbeelden_mens_subject: the church is to take care of its calling

voorbeelden: the church... is to take care of its calling
to understand that the central message here is the call to faith
God’s absolute power over the animate and inanimate creation

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' and 'power' (Dunamis) rather than human obligation. Grace is presented as a divine endowment of power and presence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'lack' (Isaiah 24) to the 'sign' (Cana) to the 'fulfillment' (Cross/Banquet).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between the Curse (S2) and Glory (S1) is resolved by Jesus' 'Hour' on the cross.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Yes, it links the lack of wine to the cosmic bondage of Sin and Death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Jesus is the primary actor; the human response (faith) is a result of the divine manifestation, not a condition for it.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus adorning the institution of marriage with his presence

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of Active Verbs

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon explicitly rejects using the text as a moral manual for marriage, prioritizing the Christological sign.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: The focus is on Jesus as the Bridegroom of the Church.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Awe and assurance in God's power and generosity.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic revelation: God acts, man beholds.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The primary program (Jesus' glory) and secondary program (Church's witness) are perfectly ordered.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'not yet' of the hour and the 'already' of the sign.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: release from the curse... bondage to Sin and Death

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the one who enables the 'beholding' of the glory.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by Christ's Doxa. The Subject is consistently divine.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the Epiphany theme.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly identified as Sin and Death.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching, keeping the focus on the divine Subject while treating the human response as a gift of the revelation itself.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would look at the use of Isaiah, semiotics sees Isaiah as the 'Sender' of the eschatological mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the wine jars; semiotics explains the jars as 'Helpers' in the manifestation of the Subject's power.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'lack of wine' is an actantial Opponent representing a cosmic lack that only a divine Subject can fill.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (will make, will destroy, will swallow up)
The Church (is to take care, points)
appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
